III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency's program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection, and
supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A visitor was able to enter the facility without being asked to
provide proper identification. While speaking with Youth A, staff
did not supervise the youth properly.
Investigation The Complainant was interviewed on 09/10/2024 and had no
additional information to provide. The complainant did clarify they
did not report that staff members argue with the residents and use
profanity and had no concerns in that area.
DHHS Worker 1 was interviewed over the phone on 09/10/2024.
She stated she recently visited the facility to make contact with a
youth. Upon arriving at the facility DHHS Worker 1 was not able
to enter the lobby because there was a group of youth that were
located there and refusing to leave, so staff had not allowed this
entrance to be used from the outside. DHHS Worker 1 was
greeted by a staff member that she could not recall and brought in
another entrance to the facility. She recalled this staff did not ask
who DHHS Worker 1 was. DHHS Worker 1 remarked she
identified herself unprompted and was also wearing her employee
identification card in view of others. DHHS Worker 1 then met
with Youth A. She stated this occurred in a lounge type room that
also was used as a pass through area from the front area of the
facility to further inside. Upon finishing her conversation with
Youth A, there was no staff available to help transport him back to
his unit. DHHS Worker 1 stated she followed Youth A back to the
front area of the building through one doorway and Youth A was
met by a staff member that she could not recall who took
supervision of him.
2

Staff 1 was interviewed on 09/11/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit at the facility. Staff 1 reported she worked as a
receptionist and office manager and often greeted outside visitors
to the facility. She described a general procedure for the facility
and visitors as having them sign in and provide identification.
Staff 1 noted there are occasions when visitors come and they
don’t have the identification that allows the facility to ensure they
know who and why they are there, and those visitors are sent
away to come back with valid identification. Staff 1 was able to
provide the sign in log for the date in question (09/09/2024).
Youth A was interviewed on 09/11/2024 during an unannounced,
face-to-face visit at the facility. Regarding the process for
speaking to visitors, Youth A stated he is always brought to one of
the rooms in the front of the facility by a staff member and then
brought back to wherever he needed to be by a staff member.
They are not always the same staff and sometimes it takes a
moment for them to be found, but Youth A stated he has never
been left alone after speaking to a visitor. Youth A recalled
meeting with DHHS Worker 1 the previous week but could not
recall which staff brought him to her and then escorted him back.
Youth A stated staff stick to their line of sight supervision within
the building and he stated he is never alone other than sleeping or
using the bathroom and showering.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone on 09/17/2024. She
recalled the instance when DHHS Worker 1 visited the facility to
speak with Youth A. Because of the issue at the time of other
youth being in the lobby and not listening to staff directives, Staff 2
let DHHS Worker 1 into the building. She recalled seeing the
identification card DHHS Worker 1 was wearing and provided
them with the normal sign in sheet. Staff 2 stated another staff
took over escorting DHHS Worker 1 to speak with Youth A at that
time.
Youth A’s Probation Officer was interviewed over the phone on
09/17/2024. She stated she has visited the facility several times
during Youth A’s placement and never had concerns over security
regarding visitors or supervision of Youth A.
Documents reviewed:
• Facility documentation for visitor registration covering the
month of September 2024 was provided and reviewed.
Dated 09/09/2024 a sign in from DHHS Worker 1 is
documented.
3

• Case documentation from DHHS Worker 1 dated
09/09/2024 was reviewed and it was noted that “State of
Michigan work Identification was presented to staff, and
they allowed access into the facility through a different
door.” It was also noted Youth A became upset at the end
of the conversation with DHHS Worker 1 and “walked off
into the lobby area” without noting which staff was next
interacted with.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per interviews of youth and
staff and documentation reviewed. There was no evidence that
the safety, supervision and protection of youth were not
sufficiently provided regarding security of outside visitors or
general supervision of youth.
Consultation provided:
• The facility is advised to write a policy regarding visitors,
security and sign-in procedures.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
